intro: Orophea chrysocarpa var. sakumbangensis, commonly known as the Sakumbang golden star, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with a leathery texture and a distinctive aromatic scent. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
